Yesterday, @SenateRules held a markup on the #ForThePeopleAct, the important voting rights legislation that will secure access to the ballot. The House passed this bill months ago, and this is a crucial step in moving forward to make this the law of the land.

Creating a National Infrastructure Bank: This project would provide federal seed money to leverage significant private sector investment in major infrastructure projects that follow environmental guidelines.

An initiative to Upcycle Abandoned Malls: As more and more shopping goes online, retail malls ‚Äî and the large plots of land they sit on ‚Äî are going unoccupied and unused, taking up valuable real estate. These areas can be redeveloped in a way that serves the community.

The Building Up the Suburbs (BUS) Act: The BUS Act would fund a regional bus rapid transit system that would run along our major highways ‚Äî or express lane transit ‚Äî to help people get from suburban hubs to major commercial hubs while skipping the traffic.

The National & Regional Greenways Act: This legislation would provide funding for major bike and pedestrian paths that link parks and community centers, supporting projects like the visionary Chattahoochee River Greenway.
